Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but non-working elevators was a let down”
Reviews.Author: PerantauDunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks on a business trip. Essentially I would have been happy with the hotel except for the fact that they only had 1 out of 2 elevators working during my whole stay. This added an extra 10 mins waiting for the elevator in the morning. Not in keeping with NY's fast paced lifestyle. Also, for 1 of the nights, both elevators were out! That meant steps up 31 floors for us. Rooms: Decent - A little small but hey, this is NY. Location: excellent. 5 mins Grand Central, 1 min Fufth Avenue and walking distance to Times Square and Central Park. Wifi: Free wifi which is good. Worth mentioning also the Salmon River restaurant downstairs is quite good especially if you want a quick meal after a long day at the office.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: johnslitch
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Everyone was extremely friendly. Front desk, maids, the man who cleaned the workout room, all were very, very nice. Room was adequate. Not posh by any means but nice. I would stay here again. Oh, and the hotel is well located.

Reviews.Title: “Way too expensive for a cleaned-up Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: tkeucla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property in 2004 for $139. It was well worth $139 a night for the location alone. I stayed there this week (March 2012) for $329. Yes, they had made improvements - new flat panel TVs, new beds and a new sink, but they have not done much else. I would have given this hotel a 1 star, but the Marriott service is good. The front desk and bell staff were of NYC caliber. They were helpful and curtious. However, the week I stayed, it was at least $100 over-priced and the value proposition was not there. If you can book for under $200, go for it. Otherwise, there are dozens of other properties for a muh better value.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, great location”
Reviews.Author: CRHeel94
Reviews.Content: As was expected in midtown Manhattan, the room was tiny. Yet somehow we were able to squeeze in a family of four (two boys aged six and eight) and our respective suitcases. The room has the basics that you would expect from a Courtyard. The location cannot be beat. Easy access to Fifth Avenue, midtown, Times Square, subway stations, etc. For a first time trip to New York where time in the hotel room is limited, this is a good option as a base to explore New York. The amenities are limited, but there is a NY style grocery shop next door that covered the basics for food and snacks. Plenty of restaurants nearby covering all sorts of preferences. The hotel staff was incredibly nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction but Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OhioScot
Reviews.Content: The room was a standard Mariott style room so very good but not great. The hotel is undergoing significant renovation so no nreakfast area or coffee like you normally expect. You could get free coffee next door with a coupon that you requested from the front desk. THe wireless internet connection was very good with hot spots for every floor, and as is usual for Courtyard properties this was free. The location is really great for the major shopping districts the garment district, Times Square, and more. Subway closeby providing easy access to the downtown and financial districts, but there is a lot to see and do within walking distance of the hotel. If you can't get in to the Marriott Marquis, or if this suits your budget, it is certainly an acceptable place to stay (even with the construction..

Reviews.Title: “Above average "regular" accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainautourdumonde
Reviews.Content: If you consider that you are in NYC, this hotel is an above average "regular" accommodation. Nothing fancy. Nothing wrong with this place. And nothing amazing. If you are looking for basic, comfortable and clean accommodation, then this place fits your needs. The rooms are quite small (but you're in NYC !). The queen bed of my room occupied most of the space available along with the working desk. Of course, no room for a reading chair. The room was clean, well decorated and recently renovated (nothing is outdated or barely working). It has a large flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable. The windows open. The hotel provides wifi in the room. But it is so slow that it is barely usable. The wired access was slightly better. Beside the too slow internet access, the only other complaint about this hotel would be that it is noisy. You hear clearly everything happening in the hallway and the noise from the street. The location, around the corner of 5th Avenue, just by lovely Bryant Park and near Times Square, is really good. So in short, nothing fancy, nothing bad hotel. It meets basic expectations. The lobby is currently undergoing work. So there is no lobby (only a table that acts as the front desk). Staff was welcoming, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place.”
Reviews.Author: ARK2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Marriott just off Fifth Avenue and really enjoyed my stay. Location is great, easily could walk to almost anywhere. I can't remember the tourist guides name downstairs just by the entrance, he booked some tickets for me and gave me a lot of information on where to go to eat some local food. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service! Excellent Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: pstirnkorb1
Reviews.Content: We looked for a location within walking distance to Times Square and some of the nearby attractions. The Courtyard was in the right spot! What was so wonderful about this hotel was actually the staff. They were very accommodating to us. We arrived on an early flight from Morristown, NJ and the weather was cold and rainy. They let us check into our room at 9:45 a.m.! I know this is not the norm, but they had availability and clean rooms so they let us in. The staff was very cordial to us the entire time, helping with directions, cabs, etc. One the last night we were there, we were looking for a local, nice restaurant. They suggested Salute! which was just "down the street and around the block." Doesn't sound bad, but which way down the street, and what block do we turn onto? The busboy at the desk actually called ahead, and then proceeded to walk us the entire way to the restaurant! He chatted along the way and was just a great kid! When we arrived and checked our coats, we went to get a tip for him and he had already left! We were amazed! We were able to catch up with him the next day and reward him for his great customer care! All it all, it was a fantastic hotel! I would defiantly recommend it again and go there when in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great location and nice service”
Reviews.Author: LovePlanAndTravel
Reviews.Content: Location: around the corner from NYC Library Noise: almost none Rooms: standard Marriott quality rooms. Very clean. Nice shower. Service: very friendly There is not much to say about the hotel other that it completely met our expectations. The room was spacious and quiet. We asked to be on the top floor and got a big room with a view over the city. Front desk service was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is small but great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but great location/”
Reviews.Author: tonypct
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night here in December to take in the City's Holiday sights and sounds. This is a very expensive hotel, and I used my Marriott points for the night, but even that was expensive! Check-in was very quick and easy. The rooms are typical NYC hotel rooms, on the small size. But the views looking south or west are spectacular. The location is what I liked best about this hotel. Especially around December time. You are literally 50 feet from 5th Avenue (the entrance is on 40th Street.) Seeing the windows on Fifth, going to Macy's, going to see the tree at Rock Center as well as taking in a Broadway or Radio City Music Hall show, are all an easy walk away. Plus, if you did want to go further, the Lexington Avenue Subway line, with connections to other major subway lines is a short walk away at Grand Central Station. And restaurants? Fuggedaboutit! They're all over the place. My wife and I always spend one night in the city at Christmastime every year. This is the first time we've stayed at this hotel and it ha snow become our favorite and the one we will attempt to stay at every year now.

Reviews.Title: “Well stayed, well read, this Courtyard Fits”
Reviews.Author: doug107
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay overnight at the Marriott Courtyard on 40th St. near 5th Avenue recently and I have to say that although all of the prices in NYC for hotels are crazy, this one was generally worth it, especially if staying on a business expense account. When I arrived the hotel was doing work on one of its two elevators. Bummer. But a well placed sign offered an apology and the front-desk staff were friendly, although a bit uppity. I came in dripping wet and dressed as I always do when traveling -- jeans, running shoes and in this case, a runner's rain jacket. Apparently this wasn't the usual outfit so it took my being a rewards member to get a smile from the clerk. After that it was smooth sailing. The hotel is half a block from the NY Public Library and if you have time in the city, I highly recommend a visit to the main library. The lending branch also is nearby, but if you don't live in NYC, returning a borrowed book could be nightmare. The main library is home to collections that fascinate both young and old, and the lower level reading room for kids is a great place to come in from the cold or rain if you're traveling with children. The Courtyard on 5th has free breakfast like all of the brands. But skip the stiff waffles and stale bagels. Head out of the hotel, make a right and then a quick left onto fifth avenue. Go down two blocks to 38th St and then turn right until sixth avenue. On the corner is a great place for breakfast, offering the perfect NY morning meal of two eggs, two slices of toast, home fries, bacon/sausage and cup of coffee for about $4. You could power your whole day with a meal here, and again if traveling with family, it's a bargain. Of course, more expensive than free, but who wants Fruit Loops anyway? All of the hotels rooms seemed to face the street and the night I stayed there was construction going on. The windows were OK, but the clang and clatter of the overnight work bothered me a bit. If noise bothers you, too, then check to see if there is any construction work going on and maybe get set of ear plugs from the many Duane Reade drug stores that dot the city's streets. The room was clean, and NY-small, but if you want to be near the heart of things - Times Square is just a five minute walk west, and Bryant Park, the home of Fashion Week and a collection of decent retail vendors, is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average place”
Reviews.Author: apollotraveller
Reviews.Content: Very well located. Clean basic room. Small but perhaps normal by New York standards. No breakfast/ restaurants. Would have been good if the cost was half of what it is. I had made a booking for early morning check in but they cancelled the room the night before. On complaining about it by email, I got an apology from the manager which satisfied me and he also offered me some bonus marriott points which.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a couple $ elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mach911
Reviews.Content: Currently staying on property. Again only 1 elevator working and it was out of order so we had to walk 25 floors to our room!!! The staff gave us $50 off our bill for that day. If you have to stay here, try and get a king room. We were first in a double but it was tiny. The staff was responsive but the property itself should not be in the Marriot chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Davisstevie
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience in this hotel. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Everything from the lobby, elevators, hallways, rooms and bathrooms was clean and tidy. Typical of a New York City hotel, space is tight, however, we had a double/double room and it had more space than some others that we've stayed in in the city. The locataion is absolutelty wonderful. It is located 1 store front off of Fifth Avenue, directly across from the NYC Library and Bryant Park. Subway stations within a few blocks in all directions, and easy walking distance to Times Square and the theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: weezee42
Reviews.Content: Had a room with two queens, not a large room, only chair in room was desk chair, very comfy beds, 24 hour coffee in lobby, only about 7 or 8 rooms per floor very quiet. Easy walk to Broadway area, or just hang out in Bryant Park.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if you can get a good rate”
Reviews.Author: CheerfulChickie
Reviews.Content: My family rented two rooms, two double beds each at this hotel for a family vacation. The rooms are clean and average size, not very big, but decent for NYC. Our room actually had 3 adult people in it. We were there only to sleep and shower, so we weren't in it long enough to feel cramped. The thing I like best about this hotel is the location. It's just 5 mins from Times Square, but far enough away that you are not smack in the middle of the crowds. Times Square is completely full of people at night so hard to get around. Union Station subway is also 2-3 blocks away from the hotel. Bryant Park is just a block down the road. My family also walked to Rockefeller Center and the shopping areas on 5th Avenue. We only took a taxi or subway when we went to SoHo and beyond. If you want to have a good fresh breakfast or lunch, there's also a great deli (Charlie's) just next door to the hotel, which serves fresh-made sandwiches, salad bar, hot food bar, small groceries, fresh fruit, just about anything you need, but in a small market environment (very quaint for being in NYC). It was very convenient after several fancy dinners, which I couldn't afford to do every night. I also don't like to eat too much fast food, so dropping by Charlie's next door was great (affordable, fresh, and healthy). I never ended up eating at the hotel at all, so can't tell you how the hotel food is. I didn't use the gym, but I did stop by to check it out. The gym is very small, but it has newer looking equipment - treadmill, bike, the basic stuff. There's no pool. The front staff is also very friendly and helpful. I didn't request early check in, but we arrived really early and they gave me my room after just 15mins of wait time. They offered to upgrade one of the two rooms we booked for free. The front desk also gave us suggestions on nice restaurants to eat at. This hotel can be pretty pricey in peak season. I went in Aug. If you can get a good deal, then the location is definitely worth it. I've stayed at the Marriott Marquis in Times Square previously, which is a more upscale hotel, but even more pricey. If you're in NYC, then you're going to be roaming the city alot and not in your room. So for that reason alone I would pick this hotel based on location. If you're looking for big rooms and luxury, then I'd stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: eekcij
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here. This hotel is small, from the front area to the room. 1 lift was in service to accommodate all of us in the hotel. Our room has 2 double beds- they are comfortable. The room is not very big. Quite claustrophobic. On the good side, the front desk is very helpful and it is close to central station and times square. For the cost I wouldn't stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: zorro514
Reviews.Content: Noisy room (the air system does not turn off), poor tv reception and very slow internet access... enough 'incentives' to look elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not horrible but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: CuriousTraveler8048
Reviews.Content: My reservations were made for me and while the hotel was okay, it is not the type of lodging I would select for myself. You know how some hotel rooms you just love to come back to at the end of the day, either because they're so attractive or cheerful or comfortable or possibly have wonderful things you don't have at home? Well, that's not this hotel. First of all, it's old but not in the historic sense, just as in it's seen better days. I reserved a king room but upon check in it wasn't ready so I was told a room with two doubles was the same size. I took it but feel incredibily cramped at under 200 sq feet. I just saw something online that said the kings are larger so misinformation somewhere but I wish I'd held out for what I'd reserved. I'm just here for another night and it certainly isn't worth changing rooms. The bathroom is clean but very basic with limited counter space if you have toiletries. The towels were clean as well but so thin they reminded me of the feel of dish towels. My room is in the back and I get almost no outside noise, which is great, but I also get no natural light. My window looks directly into the windows of the office building across from it and even had it been a sunny day, it would have made little difference. The lighting in the room is, in my opinion, too limited for working. I couldn't wait to leave for work in the morning and to go outside in the evening because it's more claustraphobic in here than relaxing. The building is tall but each floor is small with about 7 rooms so there isn't much traffic passing by and that helps it stay quiet. For some unknown reason, there is an overhead vent in the bathroom that's always running with no "off" switch but closing the door at night is enough so that is won't boether your sleep. The bottom line is that if this is more affordable than other options, there are no obvious reasons not to stay if you just want basic accommodations while you explore the city but if you are on a business trip there are probably better alternatives. Additionally, if you are traveling with kids or more than one person, this would just be too crowded. The restaurant in the hotel is okay in terms of food and price, but with very poor service. Take a few minutes to walk around the area because there are loads of options in all price ranges.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: charlieg
Reviews.Content: Very basic rooms but clean. Not too noisy given this is NYC. Great locaiton on 5th Ave so close to Times Square, Grand Central. Pleasant, friendly and helpful front desk Bryant park over the road next to library is a fantastic place to sit and watch the world go by. A real gem. Overall good stay

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Majgen
Reviews.Content: This hotel may work for only 2 people. However, we had 4, two adults and two children. We rented a small 1 bedroom suite as it came will a pull out sofa. Unfortunately the mattress on the pull out sofa was discolored, worn, tattered and uncomfortable, and could not sleep one or two. The hotel sent up an air mattress which could sleep one, and our other slept on the sofa not pulled into the sofa bed. Temperature controls were bad, with the air conditioner fan blowing directly onto us the entire night. We checked out of this hotel after one night and went to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Daf61
Reviews.Content: Could not fault any part of our trip. Staff were so helpful and room was excellent. Were given an upgrade and on 30th floor. View was tremendous!!!! Hotel was very central and within walking distance of many attractions. Would definitely recommend. Hope to go bck soon.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and plan to return”
Reviews.Author: Shishta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there the weekend of July 22, 2011, which coincidentally was the hottest weekend of the year. We found this hotel to be everything we expected (from the positive reviews) and more. The staff was so friendly and the room was super nice. The hotel has a bank of 3 computers on the mezzanine level with internet access and a printer to use if you need it. We brought our own laptop and enjoyed uninterrupted internet access in our room. They also offered a very nice selection of cable programming including HBO, which was nice. The beds were super comfortable. We both slept through the entire night and woke up refreshed. There is also free 24/7 coffee on the mezzanine level. Housekeeping straightened up our room every day and did a very nice job. The entire staff, whether housekeeping, front desk staff, whomever, greeted us whenever they saw us. We had a problem with the in room safe. For some reason, it wouldn't open one day. I called the front desk and they sent up the engineer IMMEDIATELY and he corrected the problem. I was shocked he showed up so fast. It is in the best possible location, too - close to Bryant Park and within a few blocks of Broadway, Grand Central Station and Times Square. There is even a library across the street which I didn't get a chance to visit, but plan to on our next trip. There are all kinds of little stores and restaurants nearby as well. A little tip for economical travel - there is a large .99 cent store across the street with pretty much everything you need with the exception of fresh produce. If you want to save on breakfast, you might consider picking up a package of bagels and stop in for yogurt, which was very tasty. There are all kinds of snacks there - nuts, candy, whatever you like. We bought fresh fruit from a little street vendor and his prices were very good. McDonald's is less than a block away and we were pleased to discover their prices were not too much out of line with what we were accustomed to paying locally. A salad that I normally pay $4.79 was $5.49 there and the ice cream cones were $1.00. We don't eat a lot of McDonald's but it was a welcome sight for a quick meal. I would encourage you to explore the area for restaurants. There are a lot of them and although we weren't there long enough to explore many of them, we plan to do so on our next trip there. You won't go wrong with this hotel and the location and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BermudaLover
Reviews.Content: stayed here 4 nights and we've stayed here before. room was rather small but heck, it's NYC, and small is the norm. just steps away from the magnificent 100 year old Public Library and a short walk to Grand Central Station. NYC streets can be noisy at all hours, so I figured out how to set the fan on continuous to make white noise. Front desk very efficient and friendly. Courteous valet service available. We'll probably be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dsusilo99
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with family (2 teens), location is great, room is kind of small, I guess that what New York City rooms in average. Receptionist was very nice and helpful, allowing us to check in early as well late check out. Price is reasonable, you pays for the location. Overall stay was nice. 10 Minutes of walking distance to the Times Square and Grand Central.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but............”
Reviews.Author: Jomled
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine - typical Courtyard â€“ Basic, Clean, Neat. My personal preference is a slightly larger room with a couch so I can relax while my wife gets ready for dinner. The larger rooms in this hotel overlook a dark alley behind other buildings. It was so dark that at first I thought they gave me a room without a window. I switched to a smaller room that overlooked 40th street on a higher floor which was much better. Restaurant in lobby got decent reviews but there are no windows which I found unappealing. Bar in restaurant dead after 9:30/10. Location is just great we walked to central park, Rock Center, St Pats, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Two blocks from Times Square, good base to visit New York”
Reviews.Author: eurocross
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Year. Two blocks from Times Square and great base for a few days in New York. Noise from aircons in our 6th floor room, but not a problem in higher rooms. Business centre with free internet access. Don't bother with breakfast at the hotel, but go out. Not a lot to say but a good-value location without any frills but without any downside either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: mdgalvin1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two teen daughters for the weekend to visit family and friends. Our room was very nice and most of all quiet! The location was great and convenient to the bus & metro. Just a few walking blocks to Times Square. Our room looked just like the one on the internet -- no surprises. Happy to report.....no bed bugs at this hotel! Enjoyed our stay and the staff was very helpful. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating...Stay at the Other Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: bienemy
Reviews.Content: I make business trips to NYC once a quarter and have had to stay at different Marriott properties in the area based on availability. Next trip, I will go out of my way to make sure I don't stay at this hotel. The lobby was decent, but the rooms need updating badly. I felt like I was in a closet. Maybe that's NYC, but compared to the Courtyard property just down the street and closer to Times Square, there is no comparison. My co-worker traveling complained that he had a tremendous amount of noise and had trouble sleeping. He was a couple of floors lower than me. The fitness room was unacceptable as the elliptical machine didn't change levels of resistance, in other words, it didn't work properly. The front desk staff was very matter of fact. I wasn't greeted by the staff as Marriott Gold, which is a little frustrating. I definitely will stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: joenronnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on march 2nd while on a business trip with two of my collegues. We were all put on the 29th floor. I was quite happy with the room. It was perfectly adequate in size and was very clean. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was a good size. What myself and my collegues were not happy with was the late night hustle and bustle of a maintenance worker who was in and out of the elevator and supply room all night long. I am not sure if this experienced on any of the other floors but this was crazy. In and out of the linen closet which was near my room and then in and out of the supply closet which was near my collegues room. My co-worker mentioned that throughout the night she could hear country music playing from the elevator as he went in and out and in and out. If was not for that we would have all rated the hotel higher. We reallt cannot understand why there was a need to use the supply and linen closet all night!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tenoraddict
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (3 sons 13 & under) stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel was clean and quiet, and the staff were VERY friendly and helpful. We asked for a refrigerator for our room, and received one quickly. We were on the 10th floor and the only street noise we heard was a siren or two. The location is outstanding: just a few blocks from Times Square, 1 block from a subway stop, walking distance to the Empire State Building. The only downside for us was that the room was very small, with no space for a roll-away bed. We brought a sleeping bag, and 1 of our sons slept on the floor on it.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a girls trip with three friends...”
Reviews.Author: playdobro
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice for what we needed for our trip. The hotel is a very SMALL hotel, which is OK, but it was not very well staffed when we came for our trip. This meant long waits for the concierge and bag clerk (same person) to have our bags stowed on our departure date. We stayed in a room with two queen beds, which worked well for our group. The room size was not large, but pretty good for NYC standards. The room and bathroom were clean, and well stocked with towels, etc. All in all, the hotel worked well for us for our needs. No signs of bed bugs. The location is really good which is a plus. The hotel is located right behind the NYC library and bryant park, so it is within pretty good walking distance of most things. The only time we needed to take a cab was coming back from Serendipity as that was a bit of a trek. We walked to and from Central Park on many occasions with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic service and great location”
Reviews.Author: vegiemite6
Reviews.Content: 4 of us stayed here in May 2010. The room was clean, comfortable and roomy. The staff were helpful and friendly - especially Frank on the concierge. Great location, close to transport, 5th Ave etc.

Reviews.Title: “Patience and Fortitude Await”
Reviews.Author: NeedPivo
Reviews.Content: Having found an excellent weekend rate ($119.00) for this well located Courtyard Marriott, I could not resist a weekend in Manhattan. As others have already attested, the location is a glorious one: Fifth Avenue and East 40th Street, which is conveniently situated around the corner from the Beaux Arts New York Public Library and the stone perches of Patience and Fortitude, the two statuary lions who solemnly watch the traffic of Fifth Avenue. While small for Marriott, the lobby is pleasant; additionally, the staff was attentive and professional; the property was clean, functional and well maintained. There is a restaurant attached; however, I did not utilize it. Previous reviews also mentioned that the rooms were small; however, I found mine to be large and comfortable enough with all the expected amenities*. The marble bathroom was not luxurious, but then this was not the Waldorf or the Plaza; it was nice enough for my humble concerns. Although, the regular rates ($250.00 and above), will more likely than not prevent a stay in the near future, I would definitely make a return visit with any special weekend rates. In any case, you sure cannot beat a night or two in this neighborhood â€“ Patience and Fortitude await your visit. * It should be noted that I am a member of Marriott Guest Rewards and that may have something to do with my specific room (No. 1901).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for NYC during Holidays”
Reviews.Author: jmbdt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with family 2 weeks before Christmas. Checkin was excellent. Despite a late checkin, were given 2 rooms next to each other. (We were advised on the phone prior to stay that this could not be guaranteed.) Rooms were small, but decent size for NYC and clean. There was very little street noise although we had requested a high floor and were on 22. There was a convenience store/buffet next store which was great for a quick breakfast on the go or snack. Location was good, half a block to Bryant Park which was great at this time of year. Also just a few blocks to Times Square, but not overly congested as Times Square was this weekend. No automated checkout on the TV was available, so waiting in line to checkout was inconvenient. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Overall exceeded my expectations for Manhattan at a busy time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - much better than the Marquis”
Reviews.Author: DC20something
Reviews.Content: It is a quieter property close to shopping, Grand Central, Bryant Park, New York Public Library, and tons of great food! I usually stay at Renaissance properties, but would stay here again especially for the $195 rate I got. I've stayed at many Marriott properties in NY and NJ and the staff here is among the friendliest (notably Mike at the front desk who gave me a slice of a pizza when I returned late to the hotel). The property is a Courtyard, and one of the nicer ones I've ever stayed in but certainly not as nice as Hotel 57 or Renaissance Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Will Not Return”
Reviews.Author: caruso310
Reviews.Content: I carefully read each of the online reviews before booking a last minute trip to NYC, and was prepared for a small hotel room. We wanted to stay somewhere within walking distance to all of the things we had planned for the weekend. The reviews could not have prepared me for how small these rooms actually are. They are equivalent to a small studio or a college dorm room. The bed takes up most of the room, and the bathroom is right next to the bed. The rooms are super crowded. That, however, was not our problem. Even though the room was smaller than we had anticipated, we didn't mind because we didn't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. We came back to our room at 3am after spending every ounce of time we could exploring the city. We turned on the TV and it did not work. We had to call the front desk, who called engineering in the middle of the night to fix our TV. We wanted to unwind before bed, and this was unacceptable. We received no apology whatsoever for this inconvenience. In the morning, we noticed our coffee maker was full of mold. Disgusting. But the worst part of the hotel, was the amount of noise from the halls. There was a family with children staying in a nearby room, and we could hear every word and every footstep in the morning. The door/walls are not sound proof whatsoever. Even though we saved a lot of money by staying at this hotel, I wouldn't do it again. We stayed at a different Courtyard on 53rd street a few months back for about $40.00 less. The rooms were beautiful, the staff was friendlier and more involved with their customers. Upon checking out of the 5th ave Courtyard I told them about the TV, the coffee maker, and the noise. The woman replied "well why didn't you call us about the coffee maker?". Are you kidding me? That's all we get for a response? Unacceptable, and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheGreatNugget
Reviews.Content: I haven't got anything but praise for this hotel. Great rooms and fantastic location. It is sited right around the corner from the main New York Library and Bryant Park and is about 10 yards from the intersection with 5th Avenue. This means that it's fairly quiet at night but that it takes about 5 minutes to walk to the mad buzz of Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “My Husband's finally singing "I Love New York"!”
Reviews.Author: JuliannaKempton
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler for the travel & tourism industry I go to New York about once a year. My husband, on the other hand, was in NYC in 1975 and had not been back since. Let's just say that he found many other places more desireable than the "rude and rushing" attitude that was (and I stress WAS) The Big Apple back then. To his credit, knowing my love of Broadway shows and knowing that the best place to see a Broadway show is actually on Broadway, for our 40th anniversary he suggested going to New York. Everything turned out perfectly. Our stay at the Courtyard by Marriott on E.40th & 5th was the ideal location for our rediscovering the City as a couple. With beautiful and tranquil Bryant Park next door and Times Square just 3 blocks away and an Irish Pub around the corner on 41st, we found ourselves in the perfect location. The staff at the Marriott was so friendly (as was every encounter with everyone else in the city) and the room met our every need. And yes, he actually did sing the NY jingle as we strolled through Central park! "We Love New York"...................

Reviews.Title: “Quiet hotel with superb location”
Reviews.Author: poplarfox
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, spacious (by NY standards) and clean room; high quality bathroom; staff very friendly; brilliant location about 7 mins from Times square and just off Fifth Avenue, but very quiet. Decor plain but unobjectionable. Business centre good but easily missed. Fitness room a bit basic. Good car service to airport. Only complaint : an astronomical phone bill for 2 very short calls. Make sure your mobile is going to work in the US! Overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: pacing123
Reviews.Content: Despite initial reluctance by travel companions who wanted to stay in Times Square, we were very happy with this hotel! It is conveniently located next to 5th Ave shopping, the subway, a short walk to Times Square. There are numerous delis and store/cafes nearby. The rooms are very comfortable and we found the front desk staff to be friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff helped us out of a pickle!”
Reviews.Author: speirsy83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and really enjoyed it. Great base to explore NYC from, very central and great little deli next door to get breakfast from in the morning. However the thing we were most impressed by was after we left. My husband accidentally left his suit and shirt hanging in the wardrobe...we didn't notice until near the end of our holiday when we were in Washington DC. We were put in contact with Frank, the assistant general manager, who found the suit and shirt for us, and Fed Ex'd it straight away to our hotel in DC at no charge to us!! Couldn't have been more impressed with the level of service they provided. Thank you Courtyard and Frank!!

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, good location, not very nice lobby, close to everywhere”
Reviews.Author: aleLima
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel, is not a luxury one, but it is comfortable and the concierges were extremely helpful

Reviews.Title: “extremely small rooms”
Reviews.Author: lmizza
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, Father's Day, after having been elsewhere in the city. We checked in about 5 pm, the evening front desk staff was not very friendly. We had a small issue with pricing, but no one could assist us at that time. The focus at that time was charging the extremely high room rate and not offering any type of suggestions. Once arriving at our room we were shocked to see how small the room was. We had family with us that were going to visit with us in the room until time for their train later that evening. There was absolutely no room for any type of entertaining. We had a double bed,(no room for a King) if you rolled off the side of the bed you were literally in the bathroom. No space what so ever. The air conditioner was loud, the walls were paper thin. At one point in the night, the neighbor must have "utilized" the restroom and the smell came into our room. Very, very disgusting. The remote control only changed the channel if you shook it and held it at an odd angle. But I must say the room was clean. The next morning the Manager on Duty, was able to assist with our issue so at least we didnâ€™t leave with an entirely negative impression of this hotel. Is it a great value for the price? No. Is it a great location? Yes. Would I stay there again? Never. This was a poor representation of a Marriott hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surpised!”
Reviews.Author: flyawaygrl
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute for a spontaneous weekend getaway to the city. The rate was decent for a same day booking and it included breakfast. The hotel is just off of Fifth Avenue near Bryant Park. The location is fantastic! Within walking distance to many midtown attractions including the Theater District, Times Square, Rockefeller Ctr, etc, but just a little off the beaten path so it was very quiet. The staff at check in were incredibly nice and very helpful, readily offering advice and directions to an exhibit we were planning to see. Our room with 2 double beds was small, as is typical of most NYC hotel rooms, but it was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Honestly, my only complaint would be that the large picture window was a bit clouded and the air conditioning unit made a slight rattling sound. It wasn't horrible, but just enough to make it hard to fall asleep. Breakfast was buffet style with scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, made to order waffles, fruit and cereal. The restaurant wasn't crowded at all and our waiter was very attentive. We've previously stayed at the full-service hotels including the Marriott Marquis and the Hilton for a couple hundred dollards more per night and we're kicking ourselves for not choosing this hotel for those visits! We will definitely stay here on our next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Rissa0401
Reviews.Content: I usually stay uptown during my trips to NYC. I try to stay away from midtown, but this location was in a "quiet area" and easy access to everything that we needed for this getaway. The concierge was super friendly and helpful - they helped us get our bikes into the hotel and let us keep it in our hotel room which was convenient for everyone. Room was a good size considering NYC and for the price (150$/night). Upon check out, we told them we were leaving later the evening, concierge called our car up and allowed us to park for free in front of the hotel for the rest of the day so that we dont have to come back and check it out by 1pm, etc. This allowed us to enjoy our day worry free. I would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for midtown”
Reviews.Author: bghky
Reviews.Content: We got an excellent rate for this hotel in a great location. Only $169 a night and within walking distance of Times Square etc. Room was small, but not bad compared to what I had read about for NYC. Bedding very comfortable. If I were paying $250 I might have been dissappointed, but for our rate I was very pleased and would recommend it to anyone. The Salmon River Restaurant in the hotel was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Service could be better”
Reviews.Author: gemstu
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel purely because it had reasonable reviews and was in a good area. After being before and staying in Times Square, thought i would give it a go. I booked through Opodo and got a reasonabe rate as you can for NY for 3 nights. I booked 2 x double beds and confirmation showed this, but on arrival they only had us down as 1 x double and they were fully booked with no other rooms! As there were 4 of us travelling, not really ideal. The best they could do was put a blow up bed in the room and me and my 2 daughters had to share one bed!! Not great after a long travelling day! They did move us the next day, however, but was slightly inconvienient. No offer of free breakfast or something was given either! Like it or lump it really. Apart from that, it was ok. Very basic with no views from our rooms. Not too bad size, but the location did make up for it. Perfect for shopping and 2 blocks to Times Square. Empire State Building down the road, and Grand Central Station. Overall, you do not go to NY to stay in the rooms, so really we saw very little of the hotel which suited us just fine. I would go back here if on a budget, but maybe i will try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiePortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed at this hotel in 2 years, first time was with sister, daughter and niece had lovely time then so returned again with husband to celebrate 25th anniversary. Hotel is in excellent location, close to everything we wanted to do but is quiet at night. We were on 26th floor so did have some views. Comfy beds, rooms OK size went for room with 2 double beds as slightly larger than others. Helpful but not pushy staff. Charlies Deli next door serves great food. Only problem we had was when coming out of New York airport were accosted by Shuttle Bus staff who said that we would be dropped off at hotel, this is not the case they drop you at Grand Central Station, thankfully for us this was only 5 minutes walk away. Our daughter and friend arrived late at night on the same day and were staying in a hostel, they were also told they would be dropped at their hostel, again dropped them at Grand Central and it cost them $20 for taxi to their hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: JDP527
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised how nice this hotel was...and the staff was exceptional. The location was great and the rooms were clean. My only complaint is all the noise that came from the street, I heard it all even though I was on the 22 floor.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxuray hotel but decent experience”
Reviews.Author: Sandi1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott on Fifth Ave just before New Years 2010. We got a good deal on the room. It wasn't cheap, but a great deal for NYC. The rooms were clean, the location is outstanding and provides easy access to so many different sites and places in NYC. The staff was friendly and helpful, and also gave us great recommendations for restaurants, places to go, tips on the subway routes, etc. The rooms were fine, not overly spacious but not too small either. Plenty of room. I do agree with one of the other reviews, the hallways were narrow, but I spend so little time there it made no difference to me. My one "complaint" would be that the lobby isn't a typical Marriott lobby. It is small, not a lot of sitting areas. But, the reduced price was worth it. I used the business center, plenty of room, computers, printer etc. There is a place to get coffee and the usual Courtyard "stuff". Overall a nice stay. Clean, friendly and helpful staff, and the room was spacious enough. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: GitaPe
Reviews.Content: We visited New York since we wanted to experience Christmas in New York. We are from South Africa and it is summer during the Chrstmas period. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The busboy was very helpful. He got along well with my baby and with the other guests. He helped us find our way around. There was 8 of us in total plus my 11 month daughter. I will definately visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: tke74
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. You're only 1/2 a block from all the great shopping 5th ave. has to offer. Times Square is just a few blocks away as is Rockefeller Center. We also were able to walk to the Broadway show we saw. Bryant Park, complete with ice skating rink and little shops was just down the street. Service was tricky. I don't know if they were understaffed or what, but when we got back to our room around 5:00 PM one afternoon after a full day of shopping and just wanted to relax, it still hadn't been cleaned. The desk was very apologetic though when we called to complain and someone was up within 5 minutes to clean. Hotel restaurant was very good. Service very "New York"--you know--the kind where waiter(s) try to make you feel like you've done them a favor by coming in to drop $150.00 for a couple of drinks and dinner for two people. Nothing outrageous though. We'd go back again. It was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: khotze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Courtyard Marriott for the NYC Marathon weekend and, after reading some reviews, I was expecting the hotel to be very basic. I was so surprised!! The people that work here are SO nice and SO helpful. Our room was actually really nice -- a good, clean room with granite countertops in the bathroom and nice furniture. The bed and pillows were great. I am a corporate event planner by professional and can be a bit of a hotel snob. Trust me when I say that this hotel is much better then you expect. Plus you are literally facing Bryant Park - it really doesn't get much better in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “No worth the price”
Reviews.Author: CB90292
Reviews.Content: Had one free night at the Courtyard, but second night paid the full price, which was not worth what was being charged ($279 + tax ). The room was smallish, and the majority of the amenities which one would normally expect were missing, such as no in-room safe, or mini bar. The sheets were rough, the pillows awful, the bathroom tiles chipped. In the morning, the room next door got a wake up call and it woke us up! For the same price, one could do much, much better with an equally convenient location. Certainly not up to marriott standards.

Reviews.Title: “Functional.”
Reviews.Author: uryjm
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with this Marriott and kind of expected better from this chain. I'd safely bet that this was some other chain's hotel that Marriott have bought over, because I just felt it wasn't up to the Marriott standard. The rooms were smaller than usual and felt cramped. Hardly any daylight penetrated, which didn't help, as we overlooked the back of the hotel, but the beds were comfortable and you don't come to New York to sit in your hotel room, do you? The location is just off FIfth Avenue, a two minute walk from the public library and maybe five minutes to Times Square and the Empire State. The immediate surroundings of the hotel is quite quiet though in terms of restaurants and bars. There's a small place at the base of the hotel itself - which I didn't sample - and the concierge recommended a friendly diner on Lexington for breakfast which was good. I think it was called Blooms and again was a five minute walk away. There is a coffee machine in the lobby, and there are a couple of delis and "seven eleven" style stores nearby for light snacks if necessary. Generally though, we were out of the hotel and into the subway to somewhere else while we stayed here. Next time I visit Manhatten I think I'd try a livlier area, Greenwhich Village or the East Side, to stay. This place, although dead centre of the city, is surprisingly dead itself. Combine this with a fairly non-descript hotel and I think you'll find that although you might choose to stay here, you won't be spending much time in the hotel itself - and it is quite expensive for just a place to lay your head and luggage in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: azindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and walked to so many great places. Times Square, Broadway, Rockefellar Center, NBC Studios, Titanic Museum, Hard Rock Cafe and Grand Central Station. From Grand Central Station it was a straight shot on the Subway to the Bowling Green exit where we boarded the ferry to go to the Statue of Liberty. We were doing the tourist thing and it was great for our purpose. Right next door as you are going out the door of the hotel to the left is the BEST deli/breakfast place in town! It is called Charlie's deli. During the week they have a hot breakfast buffet where you can pick what you want and pay per the pound. I ate a great breakfast for cheaper than you can eat at McDonald's. On the weekend it is order only, but it was still a great breakfast, but a little bit more expensive. The hotel staff were excellent. We had 3 rooms and were there with family. They were able to get us all on the same floor and we appreciated that greatly. Our rooms were on the 11th floor and they were typical hotel rooms. 2 full size beds, typical bathroom. But, it was all we needed. It had a closet and dresser. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel in Great Bryant Park Location”
Reviews.Author: Business_Traveler000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is servicable, and located right in the Brant Park area of Midtown; however there are many other hotels in the same area and pricepoint that are far superior. If you happen to uncover a great price, then it is OK. The staff is pleasant, and the rooms are OK (although small). Similar priced hotels in the same area that I would suggest, include the Residence Inn on 6th avenue or the Courtyard Times Square South (both just a few blocks away).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Small Rooms and Hallways!!!! Also STAY AWAY from the Salmon River Restaurant in the Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RBass10
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for a family trip to New York. The location was wonderful as it is only a couple of blocks from Times Square and within walking distance to many subway stations including Grand Central station. What sucked was the size of the rooms and the hallways. I've stayed in Courtyard Marriotts before as I am a rewards member and the rooms are normally smaller than than other Marriott brands but not THIS small. It was four to each room and we could barely move around. The distance between the beds and the TV was approximately 23 inches. NO JOKE. Also, the hallway area around the elevator and the hallways in general were very narrow. And the ice/snack machines were only on the 4th, 15th, and 25th floors of this 30 floor hotel. ???????? I would have given cleanliness five stars but there were a few spots in the bathroom that did not appear to be mopped. We covered this area with a towel so we wouldn't walk over it. The bathroom was extremely small, too. Only one person can be in the bathroom comfortably at one time unless one person was in the shower. On the bright side, the second room did not appear to be as small but it was smaller than normal. Also beware as this hotel has NO POOL. There are three computers in the hotel with free internet access which is a life saver for having teenagers with us. Unless you are going alone or with your spouse/partner (the king bed rooms probably have a LITTLE more room) I would NOT recommend this hotel. I only booked it because it was the cheapest we could get near the Times Square area at $139 per night. Most rooms in that area are far above that. Next time we'll prepare to pay a little more for comfort. We stayed at the Holiday Inn on 57th in Midtown Manhattan a couple of years ago and it was very nice. Not only did it have a pool the rooms were large, clean, and very comfortable. That room was $216 per night and we would have booked it this trip but none of the other adults in the group wanted to pay over one hundred something per night. They complained about the Courtyard throughout the whole stay so I'm sure they have learned their lesson. I made an unwise decision to have breakfast in the hotel ONE day throughout the 4-day trip. I paid $17.15 including a gratuity and the buffet only included what appeared to be powdered scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, cereals, milk, and a waffle station. The waffle was the best part of the breakfast. There appeared to be a watery substance in the egg pan so I didn't try that. I don't care for potatoes and can't really eat bacon right now so I had the sausage. It looked good but it was the most DISGUSTING sausage I've ever tasted in my life. And they DIDN'T have grapefruit juice. Do yourself a favor and have breakfast at the McDonald's across the street, find a restaurant in the Times Square area, or hop on the D train to the IHOP on 135th and Adam Clayton Powell in Harlem. For those of you who are sneezing at Harlem it is quite safe there. There are many nice shopping places on 125th and not to mention, the Apollo is on this street as well. We were actually there to witness a lot of the tributes to Michael Jackson that were taking place in front of the Apollo and all around Times Square. Even though this Courtyard Marriott did not fit the bill this was and will always be a trip to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: STL2
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a bit small for a family of 4, including 2 teenagers, but it is New York and for the price it was worth it. Room was very clean. We were on the top (30th) floor and it was very quiet as well. The beds were a good size but too soft in my opinion. Excellent location----well within walking distance of Times Square (about 5 or 6 blocks) and Broadway, and 1 block from the subway station. Short cab ride to Central Park and other local attractions. My family thoroughly enjoyed our first visit to the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, friendly and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: ritzB8
Reviews.Content: We got off the Grand Central Station and pulled our small suitcases three blocks to this Marriott Hotel. For the price, the rooms may be on the smaller side but what can you expect in NYC? If you are there sightseeing, then you're just going to be back at the hotel to sleep and the beds are the best....clean, comfy and the best! It felt like a boutique hotel without the glitter. The staff at the front desk and the bartender downstairs were very friendly, welcoming and made us feel right at home. Even the bar food was better than expected. The restaurant menu looked great but we had to skip to go to a jazz Italian restaurant on the lower East side. The location of this hotel is ideal and very central. Can't ask for more. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel . . . Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Thia68
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. Traditional Marriott hotel, very clean, comfortable, not too fancy. The rooms are small which is typical for New York. We stayed on the 26th floor (there are 30 floors) with only 8 rooms per floor. Could occasionally hear people closing doors or talking in hall, but did not hear any noise between rooms. Staff is very friendly, especially the bellmen. Small business center has three computers, two with printers and third with no printer. Small exercise room with two treadmills, a eliptical machine and stationary bike. Free coffee and tea on Mezzanine level. Elevators were very fast, never had to wait for very long. No onsite parking but there is a lot two blocks away on 38th street. Hotel offers a valet service (possibly for a fee). 1/2 a block from Fifth Avenue and the beautiful New York Public Library. 7 blocks from the Empire State Bldg. 2 blocks from the 42st. Bryant Park subway station or 1 1/2 blocks from the 42st. station for the local #7 train (which goes to Time Square or Grand Central Station, depending on direction). Within walking distance to all landmarks on Fifth Avenue: Rockafeller Center, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Trump Tower, and other high end Fifth Avenue shops. 17 short blocks to Central Park. Great deli next store, "Charlie's Deli" which serves as hotel room service. Open 24 hrs and very reasonable prices. The restaurant next store, Salmon River, serves a buffet breakfast. As a guest at the hotel, you can buy a voucher for $9.50 per person which includes tax and gratuity. If not, it's $14, not including tax or gratuity. Breakfast is until 10:00 a.m. on weekdays and 11:00 a.m. on Sat and Sun. Most places in the city stop serving breakfast at 10:00. Although we paid with points, spoke with other people who said room rates were reasonable when compared to other mid-town Manhattan hotels. Great location if visiting the city for the first time and/or with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: GirlfriendinaComaUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Courtyard Marriott Fifth Avenue in April 2009. I stayed for two nights, while my mother stayed for three nights. Upon returning home---she to her home within the US and I to my home in Europe---we both broke out COVERED in bites. My mother's doctor confirmed they were bed bug bites. These bites can take up to nine days to manifest. Despite notifying the hotel, they claim to have had a pest control company check, as well as checked with current room occupants about possible infestation. I doubt they've done either. Their hotel was the only place where we both stayed. Stay elsewhere or prepare to be a tasty meal for BED BUGS.

Reviews.Title: “should rename as something else”
Reviews.Author: Jacan
Reviews.Content: Unlike other Marriott chain hotels I stayed thus far, this hotel does not live up to the name, Marriott. Although the location was perfect for us (depending on what you're planning to do in NYC), the hotel was narrow in width off Fifth Avenue. We had 1 room with 2 beds, no extra space besides the end of beds. I was reminded of a small apartment room I used to rent when I lived here in Manhattan 17 years ago. Our room was very cold, because the heater fan was malfunctioned (I found out about it from a technician on the last day our stay-we stayed 4 nights). Although a check-in clerk promised me that he would talk to the manager to lower my rate, they still charged me $199 for the third night and $159 (airline industry rate) for the fourth night. I used points for the first two nights. After checking out, I noticed that they had lowered the rate but a check-out clerk didn't even double check to see if I got my request granted. I guess that he had a "typical" male attitude towards a minority woman like me. Only good experience was a bell man who had a pleasant smile and serving attitude, and a female clerk who was willing to exchange my bills to quarters for bus ride. She was cute. One scoop for this location is that you'll find a Japanese market on 41st street (right around the corner) and a Japanese bakery store next to it. They were awesome!! For this price, I could have stayed at Ramada New Yorker Hotel for a bigger room and bigger lobby with sitting area. At least New Yorker Hotel is more lively!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware what you read on other sites about this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Casey2782
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at this hotel. We stayed Saturday, April 4 - Sunday, April 5th. The hotel is in a good location and the staff is great, but watch out what you read on other sites. The manager told me this happens often so make sure you know what you are getting before you book!! When I booked with Orbitz, I was under the impression that we were getting free breakfast in the morning. That is not true, the restaurant at the hotel isn't owned by Marriott so you have to pay. I was told by the manager this is one of the only Marriott's in the city that doesn't provide breakfast. On the internet on numerous sites I was free breakfast. Our next surprise was that our room only had two double beds and no pull out sofa bed. We were under the impression that we would have this because of information on the Internet about the hotel. My advice is be careful what you read about this hotel. If you have questions call, don't let it be a surprise! It is in a good location, but you can stay closer to the action in Times Square for almost the same price. The reason we stayed here was because of the free breakfast and pull out bed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveller286
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal about a five min walk from Times Square. Room was big for New York with 2 double beds. Free business centre with printer available to all guests along with complimentary tea and coffee. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: holiday72
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for location, literally 1 minute from 5th Avenue and all the attractions. I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting New York for this alone! The rooms were smallish but fine for a long weekend break, it was clean and modern, nothing wow but depending on why you are in New York will depend on what sort of standard of hotel you are looking for. There was free access to the internet/printers handy for when reserving your flight seats on the way home. A restaurant/bar below the hotel too. I would recommend Brooklyn Diner in Time Square, but don't bother with Planet Hollywood if you like those sort of places.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: skowtowner
Reviews.Content: Good sized King room for NYC. Rooms on each floor that end in 01 are end rooms and much larger. No views in these rooms. Great 2 night visit, couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Aly58
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was ideal for exploring New York. Room was clean with complimentary coffee which was replenished everyday. Complimentary coffee and tea available in the foyer for guests Complimentary internet access with printer available. Staff were helpful and friendly. Deli next door with good range of food at reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Shel38
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for Family and Friends in the heart of NYC. Though the rooms are considered average size for NYC, seemed small, but very clean and fresh smelling. All of the Hotel staff was very helpful with parking, luggage, area restaurants and directions for nearby sights. Also the staff was very friendly and considerate to the children we were traveling with. They are remodeling the Lobby area so the front desk is a small space. Check in and out was rather loud but quick and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ldhTexas
Reviews.Content: We visited NYC December 21-30, 2008-so we had a long stay with 3 adults and 1 child in one room. We had a great experience with all the service-the rooms were clean and Edna did a great job in our room. Willie and Frank were also very helpful and kind. This was our first time to NYC and the hotel was close to everything we needed to get to. What a great way to spend Christmas vacation and we would come back to this hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: travelzoom
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an affordable price plus a decent location..this Courtyard offered both but I was worried about booking due to a few negative reviews listed on TA. Since our stay was during the 2nd week of Dec when NYC hotels price gouge, I decided to take a chance because of the rate...under $300.00 per night. Upon arrival at 830pm we were warmly greeted and made to feel welcome by Sophia at the front desk....she had accommodated my request for room location and the check-in was quite efficient. The room was large, clean, well appointed and the beds very comfortable. Bathroom was good size with plenty of towels (soft) a great shower and again, very clean. The only draw back was space around bathroom sink...this is not a complaint...I just seem to have alot of "stuff" and always appreciate plenty of space to place things. Lighting in hotel bathrooms can always be improved upon, especially for makeup application, and this bathroom could use better lighting in that respect. The only other item that would have been nice to have in the room was a refrig. Noise coming through the walls from other guests, which was mentioned in some other reviews, was non-existence... hallways were brightly lit and we had no problems with elevators running slow nor did we encounter any surly bellmen when we were having our luggage checked and then retrieved later in the day. One minor point...not a complaint...lobby is small so there is not many places to sit if someone needed to do some waiting etc. Happily, we found this Courtyard to be quite pleasant and would stay again. Location was fine...we did not feel uncomfortable walking in the area very late at night Almost forgot to mention.....a huge deli with friendly service and an enormous selection of food items for breakfast/lunch/dinner and snacks is right next door and around the corner on 5th Ave between 40th/41st a more upscale deli with a few tables.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Room”
Reviews.Author: GraftonTraveler24
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in December 08. The location of the hotel is very convenient. It is between 5th & Madison Aves, a couple of blocks from Grand Central and withing reasonable walking distance of Times Square. The hotel is on a small footprint. The lobby is very small and each floor only has about 5 rooms. Although we booked a king room we ended up in a double. The room was small, just enough space for the bed, a desk and a dresser. The bathroom was decent sized given the room size. All the usual amenities were present and the room was clean. Overall this is a good option for the area with the only real issue being the room downgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: JJGittes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard 5th Ave for 5 nights. Rooms were on the small side, but were modern and clean. Our room was on the 24th floor, toward the back of the building. It was VERY quiet. The staff was fine, the doormen were very helpful. The location is great, close to Grand Central, Bryant Park, and the Fifth Ave shops. Also, there is a GREAT little food store just to the right of the hotel's entrance that was so good and convenient, I would pick this hotel again just for it. I can't comment on the room prices versus other hotels, since I stayed on points. Overall, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: MichelleW2008
Reviews.Content: Great Location for sightseeing and walking around New York. We stayed here for 4 nights and Staff were v nice and helpful. Rooms not v large, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but small rooms and rude employees.”
Reviews.Author: denise_islove
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel due to the location. I had requested early check-in and was able to get in but the lady in the front was very rude, seemed careless. The room was very small! And the rooms are located so close to each other, I was able to hear the doors slam and it sounded like it was my door. Didn't like the business center. After a certain time, they are rude when they ask you to show your hotel card. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mermaid32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during a leisure trip to New York City. Our room wasn't available when we arrived, but they took our cell phone number and called when it was ready. Front desk and bell staff were very friendly and helpful, taking care of everything we needed such as a check cashed and transportation to the airport. The room we were in had a queen bed and was on the 26th floor. It was not huge but it was a very good size for a New York City hotel room. We (2 adults) had plenty of space to spread out our stuff. The room was very quiet at night (with the exception of the occasional emergency vehicle rumbling past). We did not hear noise from our neighbors at all. It was clean and well stocked with everything we needed for our stay. There was no view but we did not expect one.The location was very convenient to The Empire State Building, Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Public Library, and Fifth Avenue. It was an easy walk back to the room after seeing a Broadway Show.Grand Central Station was also close by and we took the subway everywhere else we wanted to go. We didn't eat at the hotel but there are plenty of good places to eat close by. We had a great stay and I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “What every business traveler wants from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: vibiaron
Reviews.Content: The prospect of arriving in Manhattan after 10 pm on a Sunday night did not make me happy, especially since I had to do back to back trade shows. What a pleasant relief to arrive at the Courtyard, be greeted like a friend instead of just another late check-in and - this is the best part - finding a 24-hr. deli next door that actually delivers at 10 pm! And the food is pretty darn good. Of course, Manhattan is the only place that has these great places that have hot and cold salad bars and just about everything else you can think of, some of which are open 24/7. The next day I made a terrible mistake which could have turned into a disaster. I forgot to include the slip with my dry cleaning. When I realized it that night, I called the front desk in a panic. They told me not to worry, that I wasn't the first person this had happened to and, sure enough, 30 minutes later they delivered my favorite pants to the room. The room is just fine, bed is OK, bathroom is small like most NYC hotels, but updated and clean. The view - there was none, but I had already been warned about that. The location is great - close to east side and west side appointments. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: mmbny
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NYC. This hotel was very convenient to Rockefeller Center, Times Square, and the Empire State Bldg. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The room was very comfortable and very nicely sized and overall the hotel was very clean. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: threepowells
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We stayed from 5/31-6/6/08. Within walking distance of Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central, Empire State Building, and lots of great shopping. There is a little store next door that serves a buffet at breakfast, lunch, and dinner plus has snacks, drinks, fruit, etc. Our room was very clean and, although, a little small we didn't feel cramped. I originally wanted to stay in Times Square but was very glad we stayed here because it was virtually noise-free at night. The front desk was very helpful and ready to accommodate our requests. One suggestion: request a room on a high floor so you can have a view. Will definitely stay here again when we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; Great location”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard Marriott for 3 nights in May. It was our first visit to New York City and we were looking for a centrally located hotel. It was a fantastic location, two minutes to Bryant Park and the New York Public Library! We could also walk to Broadway Theatre district, Time Square, the shops of Fifth avenue, Rockefeller Plaza and Grand Central Station. The hotel has an arrangement with a parking garage 3 blocks away where we parked our car for the weekend. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions etc..The rooms are clean and modern and just as they appear on the website - not large but we expected that in New York City. The beds and linens were very comfortable. We actually had a room on the top floor (30th) and even had a bit of view. The bathroom has been completely renovated and was actually quite large and very clean. The elevators were fast and no long waits. There is 24 hour coffee in the lobby and internet access and printers. There is also an exercise room. There is a great 24 hour Deli right next door where we could get bagels and fresh orange juice in the morning and anything else we needed. They had a huge assortment of salads, sandwiches, muffins, desserts, fresh fruit - everything! We would defintely recommend the Courtyard Marriott, especially for the location and friendly and helpful staff. There is so much to see and do in New York City...that we were only in the hotel to sleep, shower and change walking shoes at noon! We will probably stay here again on our next trip to New York city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: patienceEngland
Reviews.Content: Our first time in New York and we felt really at home in the hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. We were amazed at how quiet it was inside the room. Made great use of the free internet . The location was brilliant - easy walking distances to so many places ( Grand central, Empire State, Times Square, ) and the subway was 2 minutes away for further excursions. Had breakfast once at the hotel but found Charlies next door more versatile and much ,much cheaper. Ate at Salmon River ( hotel restaurant) 3 times and enjoyed the food and the service. We will certainly stay there again next time we come to New York

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Lekookoo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now, while in New York on business. The first time was a complete fluke, as it was merely one of the hotels with which our convention organizers had negotiated a favorable rate, and we picked it pretty much on price (it was one of the more reasonable options.) We were surprised and charmed by the helpful staff, who were consistently delightful and very patient with a couple of nervous Canadians. When I telephoned the front desk a couple of days prior to our arrival to confirm our room, I asked whether it would be better to take a cab from the airport or to grab one of the airport shuttles. The desk clerk put me through to the doorman on duty, who very kindly outlined the best route, told me what I should expect to pay, and generally how not to appear like a rube ("Tell the cabbie to take the tunnel, it's cheaper," he said.) The rooms were small but comfortable, in each case. The bathrooms were obviously recently renovated. The restaurant in the hotel is convenient, if a tad expensive. There were two computers available for guests' use, with free internet access, allowing you to check flight status and email. The hotel is located beside a twenty-four-hour convenience store / deli that sells hot and cold food, great for a snack. There are tons of little restaurants within walking distance, especially a few streets to the east (Lexington Avenue, I think) where we discovered a nice Japanese place and a Moroccan place, both reasonably priced. There were more attractive restaurants than we had time to try, in each case. A great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “hotel disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TwinkieCat
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in an excellent location of Manhattan. The hotel appears to be "squeezed" in between to other buildings. I was surprised of how tiny the lobby was. If you want any type of room view request a room in the front of the building. Your view will be overlooking the NY Public Library. I must remind you, you are located on a busy street so you will hear traffic and plenty of sirens from police and ambulances. Bring earplugs. Plenty of fast food places and shopping close by. Broadway just a few blocks away. Only one person can get into the bathroom at one time. The water temp was not very hot for a shower. The hallway is so small, two people cannot possibly so side by side at the same time. If you get a room on the non-street side you will be looking at brick walls from the neighboring hotels...no view at all. It looked depressing. The staff was so-so. Appeared not to like their jobs. When we called to have the Conceirge to call for restaurant reservations for two separate nights. He was rude and said he was too busy and to call back in about an HOUR! I couldn't believe it and actually went immediately downstairs and found no manager on the premises, so will contact Marriott to complain when I return home. No help available at night to help with luggage. Although I'm trying to remain positive in regards to positive things of the hotel. The last good thing about it was a GREAT deli next door. This is also your room service...which does time a long time to receive. All in all, for a frequent traveller, I was highly disappointed in this hotel and never will return.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: slanMunster
Reviews.Content: Beware when booking this hotel. Booked through Marriott website months ago for 5 nights from 14-19 March and had confirmation received at the time. Yesterday the hotel emailed me to say they had received my cancellation (which I never sent). Have rang them twice from Ireland to undo cancellation with no success. They say they have no room available. I think it is disgraceful to overbook the hotel and then try to blame it on the customer. If I cancelled it then why didn't they send me back a copy of my email cancelling - because it didn't happen - that's why! so disappointed in the Marriott - will never stay with them anywhere in the world, never!
